attributes.action: Remove the cycle lane on Bidston bypass in Wirral.
attributes.additional_details:
Wirral council have put extra wide cycle lanes on one of the busiest roads in Wirral causing absolute chaos. 
What will emergency services do when they can’t get through in the case of a fire, accident or someone having a heart attack? 
They could’ve widened the pathways on either side. 
Their mentality in wanting to reduce emissions and creating quiet neighbourhoods with lower traffic levels is flawed. Allowing the building of several hundred new houses totally contradicts this.
attributes.background:
Order Wirral council to remove the cycle lanes on the Bidston bypass. 
They didn’t consult the public nor take into consideration the chaos it would and is causing. This is the main arterial route to West Wirral and Liverpool.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local roads are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
